intro: Rabdosia phyllostachys, commonly known as the Chinese skullcap, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Rabdosia phyllostachys is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for various ailments.
